law.catch_line: "Calendar year," "calendar quarter," "week," and "week of unemployment" defined.
law.text:
As used in this chapter, unless the context clearly requires otherwise:
Except in so far as the Education and Workforce Development Cabinet by regulation prescribes the equivalent thereof to meet particular conditions:
"Calendar year" means a year beginning on January 1; and
"Calendar quarter" means three (3) consecutive months beginning on January 1, April 1, July 1, or October 1;
"Week" means such period of seven (7) consecutive calendar days as the Education and Workforce Development Cabinet regulation prescribes; and
"Week of unemployment" means any period of seven (7) consecutive days, as prescribed by the Education and Workforce DevelopmentCabinet in administrative regulations, during which a worker performed less than full-time work and earned less than an amount equal to one and one-fourth (1-1/4) times the benefit rate determined for him in accordance with the provisions of subsection (2) of KRS 341.380.
law.history: Amended 2009 Ky. Acts ch. 11, sec. 70, effective June 25, 2009. -- Amended 2006 Ky. Acts ch. 211, sec. 133, effective July 12, 2006. -- Amended 1998 Ky. Acts ch. 426, sec. 565, effective July 15, 1998. -- Amended 1996 Ky. Acts ch. 271, sec. 14, effective July 15, 1996. -- Amended 1974 Ky. Acts ch. 74, Art. VI, sec. 107(24). -- Amended 1972 Ky. Acts ch. 21, sec. 6. -- Amended 1950 Ky. Acts ch. 206, sec. 1. -- Amended 1942 Ky. Acts ch. 20, secs. 1 and 7. -- Recodified 1942 Ky. Acts ch. 208, sec. 1, effective October 1, 1942, from Ky. Stat. sec. 4748g-3.
